questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which command must be used to restore configuration changes made by disabling the PIM feature and skipping any errors?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is correct. Best-effort is the rollback type that skips any errors.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/6-x/system_management/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_System_Management_Configuration_Guide/sm_7rollback.html

Selected Answer: CE
In a Cisco Nexus 9000Series chassis with dualsupervisors, you can use the in-service software upgrade (ISSU)
feature to upgrade the system software while the system continuesto forward traffic. An ISSU usesthe existing
features of nonstop forwarding (NSF) with stateful switchover (SSO) to perform the software upgrade with
no system downtime.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/dcn/nx-os/nexus9000/101x/configuration/high-availability-and-redundancy/cisco-nexus-9000-series-nx-os-high-availability-and-redundancy-guide-101x/m-issu-and-ha.pdf
so the corect answer is C and E

questions.question_text: Which two features are used to allow a nondisruptive upgrade for the ISSU process? (Choose two.)

An engineer must perform an initial configuration of VXLAN and MP-BGP EVPN on the Cisco Nexus 9000 Series platform. The underlay must be OSPF, and the VTEP must run with distributed default gateway on a VLAN interface. Which command set must be applied to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Looks like needed features are:

nv overlay evpn
feature ospf
feature bgp
feature pim
feature interface-vlan
feature vn-segment-vlan-based
feature lacp
feature vpc
feature nv overlay

answer A is the closes one

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/border-gateway-protocol-bgp/200952-Configuration-and-Verification-VXLAN-wit.html#anc7:~:text=!%20Enabling%20features-,nv%20overlay%20evpn%0Afeature%20ospf%0Afeature%20bgp%0Afeature%20pim%0Afeature%20interface%2Dvlan%0Afeature%20vn%2Dsegment%2Dvlan%2Dbased%0Afeature%20lacp%0Afeature%20vpc%0Afeature%20nv%20overlay,-!%0A%0Afabric%20forwarding
[A] seems like the answer. Although feature pim is missing.

choices.D:
NX9K(config)# feature nv overlay

NX9K(config)# feature bgp -

NX9K(config)# feature bfd -

NX9K(config)# feature ngmvpn -

NX9K(config)# feature ospf -
NX9K(config)# feature interface-vlan
choices.C:
NX9K(config)# feature nv overlay

NX9K(config)# feature bfd -
NX9K(config)# feature fabric forwarding
NX9K(config)# feature vn-segment-vlan-based

NX9K(config)# nv overlay-evpn -

NX9K(config)# feature ospfv3 -
choices.A:
NX9K(config)# feature nv overlay
NX9K(config)# feature vn-segment-vlan-based

NX9K(config)# feature bgp -

NX9K(config)# nv overlay-evpn -

NX9K(config)# feature ospf -
NX9K(config)# feature interface-vlan
choices.B:
NX9K(config)# feature nv overlay

NX9K(config)# feature bfd -
NX9K(config)# feature vn-segment-vlan-based

NX9K(config)# nv overlay-evpn -

NX9K(config)# feature ngmvpn -

NX9K(config)# feature ospf -

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The answer is correct.

questions.question_text:
A content delivery network sends video traffic to a multicast distribution device where the receiver requests the traffic from the multicast distribution device through an IGMP join message. When the traffic reaches the multicast distribution device from a CDN, the switching network populates the multicast routing table in the group (S,G), and the multicast distribution device sends the required traffic back to the receiver.

Which feature is used to send back the traffic from the streamer to the receiver in the group (S,G)?

choices.C: They are independent of the Cisco NX-OS ISSU process.
choices.D: They execute simultaneously on multiple modules.
choices.A: They do not cause service disruptions.
choices.B: They are performed during an ISSU system and kickstart upgrade.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The EPLD image upgrades are independent from the Cisco NX-OS In Service Software Upgrade (ISSU) process, which upgrades the system and kickstart images with no impact on the network environment.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/6_x/epld/epld_rn_62.html#20945

questions.question_text: What is a feature of EPLD upgrades on a Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switch?
